page.title: 04School Days
page.content: Karen's grandmother went to school in Ashington between l9l9 and l928. Her first memory of school was teaching a boy to knit in the infants school. In her last year her main subjects were reading, writing, arithmetic, scripture, history & geography. These were taught by the same teacher, a common feature of schooling before the second world war. Work was done in exercise books with a pencil. Practical work consisted of needlework and drawing.{Punishments}were severe - the{strap and tawse. }There were no audio-visual aids for teachers ie. radio, TV & films. There were no school visits. Her favourite lesson was needlework the least enjoyable was history. She did not like learning about events l00 years before {School meals}were not provided & pupils wore their own clothes for PE.
